div1.p: Original No.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

p.add: In Re application of F. S. Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

figure.p: Filed In The U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Sep301915 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk By Ed. M Lakin deputy

div1.p: Geo. D. Emery Attorney for appellant
Telephone: Elliot 4606
419 Central Building Seattle, Wash.
At which office they consent that serivce of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them
Bull Bros. "Just Printed"
Service of within Petition this 30th day of Sept1915 and recepit of a copy thereof, admitted, Frank P. Helsell
Attorneys for resp.
In the United States District Court For the Western District of Washinton, Northern Division.
In the matter of the application of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Assignment of Errors.

Comes now Francis Stephen Medcraf, the petitoner above named, by Geo. D. Emery Esq. his attorney, and files the folliwing assignment of errors upon which he will rely upon his appeal from the decision, order and judgment made and entered by this Honorable Court on the 30thday of September A. D. 1915, in the above entitled cause, denying the petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and for dishcarge of the petitioner.
A. - The United States District court in and for hte Western District of Washinton, Northern Division, erred in granting the motion of the STate of Washinton to quash the writ issued herein.
B.- The United States District Court in and for the Western District of Washinton, Northern Division, erred in denying the Write of Habeas Corpus, as prayed in the petition herein.

C.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washinton, Northern Division, erred in refusing to discharge the petitioner from custody and from imprisonmen, as prayed in his petition herein.

D.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washinton, Northern Division, erred in holding that the law of the State of Washington set forth in the petition herein, under which the petitioner was convicted of practicing dentistry without a license etc., was and is valid and in refusing to hold the same void and in contravention of the provisions of Article XIV of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States.

E.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in holding that the law of the State of Washington under which the petitioner was convicted of the alleged offense of practicing dentistry without a liscense was not
in contravention of the provisions of Article V of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States., and in refusing to hold the said state law void.
F.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in rendering judgment herein against the petitiioner.

Wherefore the said petitioner, appellant, prays that the judgement of said Court be reversed and such directions be given that the petitioner, appellant, may be discharged from custody and the full force and efficiency may inure to the petitioner, appellant, by reaosn of the facts, matters and things set up in his petiton filed in this cause.
Geo. D. Emory Attorney for petitoner and appellant herein. 419 Central Building Seattle, Wash.
